Posts.Content: jlw23 wrote: I am 30 years old, and a week ago noticed I had a bloody discharge coming from my left nipple. I went into see my doctor the next day and she said she could NOT feel any lump, but wanted to send me for a mammogram. Today I went in for my 1st Mammogram and ended up having to have an ultrasound done too.  The doctor told me that in my mammogram there was a cluster of calcium that were close to my nipple in my left breast. He wants me to have a Stereotactic Guided Biopsy done. The appointment has been set for the 27th of September, and I AM SCARED!!!  I feel like the doctor wasnt giving me enough information, and all I coming across online is how it is Cancer.... Does anyone have an advice or a similar story out there?????? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Clustered Breast Calcification, Anyone deal with this? jlw23 VSM

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 11:51AM jlw23 wrote: Thank you Cycle-Path and VSM!!! All of this information as helped calm me a little. It's just hard because of the waiting and the fact that I can NOT do anything to make it better between no and then. =(
Posts.Title: Clustered Breast Calcification, Anyone deal with this? jlw23 VSM

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2011 11:23AM jlw23 wrote: dlm217: I am so sorry to hear u are going through the same thing! It is all such terrible feelings I dont wish it on anyone! I just had my appointment moved to the 22nd for the same thing a Stereotactic Biopsy.  I havent seen my report, Is that something they usually tell you about (BI-RADS 5)???
